General_nokit_stable_they_jointpain_ToAn: [You're aware of a session in the nursery and decide to engage today as encouraged by both l_n and d_n. t_c sits calmly in the nursery, surrounded by the kits and apprentices. r_q briefly thanks them all for being so polite and gestures for t_c to start.]

Thank you and all that you do here for the nursery. Before I begin, my name is t_c, I am a warrior and one of your fellow Clanmates here in c_nClan. But as some of you may already know, I have a bit of trouble with my joints.

Sometimes they ache a little, other times they hurt quite a lot and I'll need to sit down for the day. r_q was kind enough to invite me here today to teach you young ones about my condition. I think it's very important that as a clan we educate each other on these topics.

I was an apprentice at six moons and then became a warrior. I'm sure you've all heard it before but training is very hard work. But I persevered, as will all of you. When I was diagnosed, it was like my world turned upside down.
To be told that you won't be able to perform to the best of your abilities is rough. Knowing that it was something I had to live with, was rougher. But, it changed my perspective on things. On life.

I learned that while there are things I couldn't do, I learned there were things I could do differently. I learned how to adapt, change and better myself. I didn't choose this, no one chooses their conditions.

That's all the more reason to fight back. Earn your place and do so with pride. For example, on days where my joints are sore; a little fern warmed in the sun wrapped tightly helps relieve that stress. By stretching every morning I can stay flexible and of course, the medicine den is always there to support me.

If you are going to take anything away from this today; take away the fact there is no right way. Yes, there are things I can't do, I can't climb as well or jump as high. To compensate, I learnt to swim. Thanks to that, I can still hunt. I still serve c_nClan my way.

You kits are our future, it will be your duty to support each other, regardless of the limits of your bodies. Don't give up, give things a go and if something is absolutely out of your ability, it's okay to be upset. It's okay to second guess yourself, but don't be afraid to reach out for help and think differently.
I could ramble on and on but, I think that's enough from me. Now, I'm about to go hunting, I'm sure r_q would be kind enough to let you all see how I do things.
